dialogues.text: I‘m sure. I should’ve shot him first, but I didn’t have a clean shot, I was afraid I’d hit the girl.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (OFF)
dialogues.text: Tomorrow you can take care of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo is at the door of another room. Checking to make sur it’s all clear, he enters:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miriam sits up in bead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Shhhh. We need to talk. Kee awakening --

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: What‘s the matter? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Luke killed Julian.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: That was Patric on the motorcycle. we need to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: We’re not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Kee, Julian told you to trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo looking out the side door. There’s a row of six cars parked in front of him. Two Fishes standing nearby. Activity in the barn. He steps out the door... SQUISH! Theo’s expression -- he forgot to get his shoes. He continues, moving quietly to car in front of him. He opens the door...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE 1ST CAR
dialogues.text: Through the windshield, Theo sees the Fishes up ahead. He reaches down to the hood release -- POOK! The hood pops open. The Fishes do not hear it.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE 1ST CAR
dialogues.text: Theo squatting, sneaking around to the front of the car. Lifting the hood quietly. Reaching in... YANKING OUT the distributor cap. He gently lets the hood down.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE 2ND CAR
dialogues.text: Theo repeating the operation. POOK! He opens the hood. He’s about to get out, when: Fish 2 returns from the barn, heading directly to the car his hands and coat bloody. Theo hunches on the car floor.

dialogues.speaker: FISH 2
dialogues.text: (to the nearby Fishes) Man, I don’t think he’s going to make it. Fish 2 reaches into the car, just above Theo’s head, feel for: a pack of cigarettes on the dash. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FISH 2
dialogues.text: (continues) His bones are sticking out, no skin, no way to hold the blood in... Fish 2 snags the cigarettes, walking away.

dialogues.speaker: FISH 2
dialogues.text: (as he leaves) ++-and all that sand and dirt stuck in there, how are they ever gonna get that out? Hearing Fish 2 leave, Theo reaches over to the hood relea switch -- POOK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo enters the side door. Kee and Miriam wait just insid

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FARM HOUSE --- BEFORE DAWN
dialogues.text: Day about to break. It’s dark, and the clouds are bloody red. Theo peers out the side door: two Fishes are standing nea the front, trying to stay alert, trying to stay warn. Theo leads Kee and Miriam to the Vauxhaul, the first car parked in the row. Quietly opens the back door for Kee. S slips into the back, while Miriam slips into the front do They close the doors without shutting them.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VAUXHAUL
dialogues.text: Theo slips into the front seat, gently closing his door. Through the windshield: the Fishes have not noticed.

dialogues.speaker: . THEO
dialogues.text: Okay... The key is in the ignition. Theo turns it -- HA-RUMPH! After the first spark, the engine dies. Through the windshield: 2 nearby Fishes REACT to the sput

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (quietly) Shit! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Theo tries again -- HA-RUMPH! Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Battery’s dead. Through the windshield: the Fishes start walking to the c

dialogues.speaker: FISH 6
dialogues.text: Mark? Theo releases the brake and pushes in the clutch -- the c starts rolling slowly down the steep muddy road. In the direction of the approaching Fishes.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Shut the doors! Miriam and Kee and Theo pull their doors shut. Miriam hit switch -- FWICK! The car doors lock.

dialogues.speaker: FISH 6
dialogues.text: Mark?

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF DRIVEWAY
dialogues.text: The Vauxhaul picking up a little speed, bouncing down the steep rutted road, heading right at the Fishes.

dialogues.speaker: FISH 6
dialogues.text: (shouting the alarm) Alert! Theo checks the speedometer: 5 mph.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE OF DRIVEWAY
dialogues.text: Fish 5 stands in the muddy track, holding up his gun, pointing it at the oncoming car.

dialogues.speaker: STOP
dialogues.text: The car still coming. Fish 5 about to shoot...

dialogues.speaker: HOUSE
dialogues.text: Luke steps out of the door --

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: NO! DON’T SHOOT!  60.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE OF DRIVEWAY
dialogues.text: Fish 5 looks confused, the car still coming at them. He lowers his gun. He and Fish 6 try stopping the car with their hands, but the weight and momentum of the car surpa their strength. They have to step aside. More Fishes come running from the barn. Patric tearing ou of the house.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: The girl’s in the car! Don’t shoot!

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Somebody get a car!

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE OF DRIVEWAY
dialogues.text: Fish 5 and 6 chase down the slow moving car, grabbing the doors, but they’re locked. Fish 5 sticks his hand through the half open window, trying to pull the car to a stop...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE VAUXHAUL
dialogues.text: Kee punches the intruding hand, trying to break its grip, Fish 5 hangs on...

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF DRIVEWAY
dialogues.text: More Fishes join the chase. So does Patric, running down muddy road after the car... Two other Fishes head for the row of parked cars.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE VAUXHAUL
dialogues.text: Kee bites the hand trying to pull back the car. Fish 5 yelps, releasing his grip, allowing the car to gain momen Fish 6 slips down in the mud.

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF DRIVEWAY
dialogues.text: Fish 2 steps’ from the car.

dialogues.speaker: FISH 2
dialogues.text: It won’t start!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE VAUXHAUL
dialogues.text: Theo turns: they now have some distance from their pursue He checks the speedometer -- 10 mph.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ‘ THEO Okay, okay, okay... Here we go... Theo shifts into 2nd gear, releases the clutch -- HA-RUMP The car shudders, but doesn’t start. He tries it again -- RUMPH! No success. And now the car is almost stopped. Kee looks out the back window: the Fishes are gaining.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: They're coming! Theo lets out the clutch, allowing the car to start rolli down the hill.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: {begging the car) Go, go, gO, go, go.... The Fishes getting closer. Patric is coming full speed, running faster than the rest.

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF DRIVEWAY
dialogues.text: At the row of cars, two Fishes push a 2nd car into motion As it picks up speed, both Fishes jump in, the momentum carrying them downhill...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE VAUXHAUL
dialogues.text: They approach the end of the muddy track, one big ditch, right before it intersects the paved road. Speedometer: 9 mph. Theo shifts into 2nd gear, about to release the clutch, w he turns to see: Patric has caught up, running even with back bumper, gain

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE OF DRIVEWAY
dialogues.text: The 2nd car coming downhill picks up speed.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE VAUXHAUL
dialogues.text: Theo can’t afford to slow down, letting the car keep roll Patric catching up, keeping pace, locating Theo, raising pistol. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PATRIC
dialogues.text: (shouting) Got a shot! Got a clean shot! Theo in disbelief, Patric running alongside, about to sho him at close range, when Kee kicks open her door -- FWAR! Kee’s door hits Patric’s back, tripping him up, sen him tumbling, bouncing hard across the mud and rocks. The car headed right for the ditch --

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Hold on -- !

dialogues.speaker: BOTTOM OF DRIVEWAY
dialogues.text: The car crashes into the ditch, throwing up mud --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE VAUXHAUL
dialogues.text: Theo, Kee and Miriam bounce with the impact...

dialogues.speaker: PAVED ROAD
dialogues.text: The momentum carries the car through the ditch, flying up onto the paved road, where it bounces to a complete stop.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE VAUXHAUL
dialogues.text: Theo looks back at Kee.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Yeah, just go, go, go!

dialogues.speaker: BOTTOM OF DRIVEWAY
dialogues.text: The Fishes still running down toward them. The 2nd car is coming fast, right at their Fishes’ backs...

dialogues.speaker: PAVED ROAD
dialogues.text: Theo jumps out of the Vauxhual.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (to Miriam) You know how to push start a car? Miriam slides over to the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Just push, push! Theo runs to the back of his car. He’s wearing only socks He starts pushing. As the car starts picking up a little speed-- HA-RUMPH! Miriam releases the clutch. Stopping the car.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Wait till it goes faster! Theo looks back:

dialogues.speaker: BOTTOM OF DRIVEWAY
dialogues.text: The Fishes part, making way for the fast coming 2nd car. Fish 2 doesn't get the message, still in front of the car

dialogues.speaker: VOICES
dialogues.text: Move away, off the road -- Too late. The 2nd car runs down Fish 2, just as it SMASHE into the ditch, the momentum carrying it to:

dialogues.speaker: PAVED ROAD
dialogues.text: The 2nd car bounces to a stop. Not 30 yards from Theo.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE PAVED ROAD
dialogues.text: Theo is pushing for all he’s worth. His socks are bloody. The car picking up speed. He turns to see: The Fishes have jumped out of the 2nd car, running toward them, catching up...

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (to Miriam) Now! Now! The car shudders, the reluctant engine hesitating a momen before -- VA-ROOM! The engine finally roars to life. The car now is pulling away from Theo. He turns: the Fish are gaining. One pulls out a gun, aiming... Miriam stops the car, 10 yards ahead, Theo gasping, tryin make it, Kee looking from the back window.

dialogues.speaker: FISH 4
dialogues.text: (seeing Kee) Don’t shoot! Behind them, more Fishes have reached the paved road, joi the chase. Theo reaches the car, the door opens from insi

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE VAUXHAUL
dialogues.text: Theo jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Go, gO, go, go! Miriam shifts it into gear, the car lurching forward. Through the back window, we see the Fishes receding. Behi them, the sun cracks the horizon, rising.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Theo about to vomit, out of shape, out of air -- on the v of complete collapse.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What about Bexhill?

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: The Human Project sent a floating hospital. It's disguised as a fishing boat, but the cabin is equipped with the best surgical equipment, and the best doctors. It’s following the cod run. Yesterday was the rendezvous in Dover. The only other one is in Bexhill, tomorrow, until sunset.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: “The Tomorrow.” (off his look) Name of the boat. Gonna be next to a buoy. With flashers. Theo still gasping air into his lungs, looks at Kee.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Cheedo.  65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vauxhaul pulling off a small road near some woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo gets out of the car. He walks to the middle of the road, making sure nobody is there. Then he goes to the fa hedge by the trees. Lifting the bushes, moving them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car crossing the narrow dirt track in the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the windshield, we are approaching a house rigged with make-shift solar panels. Jasper’s house. EXT. JASPER’'S HOUSE -~ DAY The car parks in front, next to Jasper’s car. Theo climbs out. He goes to the front door and knocks.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Jasper. Hello? Theo opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo walks into the house.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Jasper? The house is a mess. Glasses and dirty plates, books left strewn around. He walks into:

dialogues.speaker: JASPERS STUDIO
dialogues.text: From behind: Jasper on the sofa, his hand dangling lifele off the armrest... a bottle of pills spilled on the floor On Theo’s face, hesitantly approaching around the couch.. Jasper lays in peaceful repose, his long hair partially obscuring his face. The sack containing Janice's ashes on his lap, open, his other hand clutching some of the ashes Theo lets out a painful sigh. He leans to his old friend. Pushing the hair away from Jasper’s face, when -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jasper opens ‘his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: Huh...? Theo reacts --

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: Fuck you! The two men share a look -- they nearly scared each other death. A hint of Jasper’s old mischief flashes in his fac

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: Amigo... But it fades away, and Jasper breaks down, sobbing. Theo leans down and hugs his old friend.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: I can’t make it, Theo. I can’t make it without her... Theo holding Jasper. Kee and Miriam entering the room.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Jasper. Meet Kee. Theo swivels Jasper around. Jasper looking at Kee -- disbelief, recognition... awe. INT. JASPER‘S KITCHEN -- DAY Theo’s wretched feet soaking in a bucket of water. Jasper the stove, frying eggs.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: .-.the blokes who started the great cathedrals knew bloody well they’d never see them finished. But they built them. You know why? The certainty. They had faith that the new generations would complete what they started. Lovely, isn’t it? Faith and certainty. Jasper looks at Kee, her feet propped up, munching biscui (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: Kee, your baby is the miracle the whole world has been praying for. Hallelujah, hosanna, shanti, shanti, shanti. Jasper delivers Kee a plateful of eggs.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: We need to get to Bexhill.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What about the border cop? The guy who runs your pot.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: syd?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Could he get us over? All eyes on Theo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Get him to arrest us. Like Foogies. We get deported into Bexhill. Jasper considers this.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: Waaaaaaah! That's good, amigo! Deported like Foogies. I like it. Jasper looks at Kee.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: Kee, everything is going to be quite groovy. The old man is young again. EXT. JASPER’S HOUSE -- DAY Miriam near the woods, doing Thai Chi exercises. INT. JASPER’S LIVING ROOM -- DAY Theo watches Miriam through the window, opening his flask Kee is laid out comfortably on the couch, her exposed bel propped on a pillow. A fire blazing in the chimney. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ‘ KEE She doin’ her craze?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Hm? Theo sips from his flask.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Her flittin’.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (smiles) Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: She smited me with that. Said it was good for my baby. And my shockers.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Chakras.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Yeah. She look posh to you? Or gawky? Theo observes Miriam -- standing on one foot, the other hovering in the air, trying to keep her balance.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: She looks earnest. Theo turns: Kee’s beautiful belly, lit softly by the firelight. He’s about to sip his flask, but stops.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: How long have... how many months -- ?

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Eight. (off his look) Takes nine months.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Ahum. Silence. The fire crackling.

dialogues.speaker: TREO
dialogues.text: And who’s the, who’s the --

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: (sharp) Father? That what you wanna know? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Whiffet. I'ma virgin.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Cha, be wicked, eh?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: That it would. Theo smiles.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Fuck knows. Omar. Sammy. Phil. Most of them wankers don’t know their names. Did some for quid, some for drugs. Some... Fuck knows, I was horny. You know the cock’n bull. Theo doesn’t know, still holding his flask, not drinking.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Ahun. Through the window: Jasper walks out of the greenhouse, a small backpack around his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: When I started puking, thought I catch the pest. And I think -- “bitch, you are whoppingly fucked.” But then me belly start gettin’ big, and I think -- “this not big fart stuck in my belly!” No, this fuckin’ spooky. Never seen a pregnant woman. Nobody ever told me these things. But I knew. Got a baby in my tummy. Cheedo, eh?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Uh huh. From outside, they hear: “Huh! Huh! Huh!” Miriam exhaling loudly, a breathing exercise.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: I feel like a freak. I was ‘barrassed. I was ’fraid. Didn‘t tell no body. I think about that Quietus thing. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: *Sposed to be suave. Pretty music, treat you cheedo. (beat) Then the baby kicked. Kee breaks into a big smile, her mood now bright.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Whew! I feel him. Little bastard was ‘live. aAnd...I feel it. Me too. I was ‘live. (beat) Didn’t know what to do. Talked to me mate, he knew the Fishes. Told me they would help me. I met Julian. She was suave.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (smiles) She was suave. Theo considers a drink. Then closes his flask. Jasper wal in the door.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: Rock ‘n roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jasper with the backpack, leading the group up the hill through the woods, his house behind them. They are bundle in coats against the cold, Kee in a cloak that hides her pregnant belly. Theo stops.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: No-man’s land. A cold steel jagged-tooth barbed wire fence cuts across t woods: “MILITARY ZONE. POSITIVELY NO TRESPASSING.”

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: No-man’s land? Jasper searches the fence.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: The two mile zone around Bexhill, dear. Nobody's supposed to be in it. Makes it easy for the migra to bag Foogies that trying to escape from the camp. (finding it) Here. Jasper locates the spot: a cut in fence. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: Old smuggling route. Jasper pulls back the barbed wire.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: Theo, you go first. Theo steps through -~- RIP! His pant leg tears.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: Get the skin?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: Grab the other side. Your turn, Kee. EXT. WOODS (NO MAN’'S LAND) -- LATE AFTERNOON The light is fading. The group walking across a long clearing, nearing the end. Kee moving steadily with Theo’ help. Miriam has a fist full of wild flowers.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: (to Theo) How’re the dogs?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: Your feet. Theo is wearing an old pair of boots.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (in pain) uh.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: Almost there. (gestures) Other side of the hill. They arrive at the end of the clearing, at the woods. The in the silence -- WOOF! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: There...

dialogues.speaker: OTHER SIDE OF THE CLEARING
dialogues.text: A GERMAN SHEPHERD howls the call for the hunt. Three more German Shepherds-come running from the woods, now running together in a pack. Running toward the group.

dialogues.speaker: END OF THE CLEARING
dialogues.text: The group starts running toward the wooded area ahead.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: Quick -- go!

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE OF THE CLEARING
dialogues.text: The pack of dogs closing the gap.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TREES
dialogues.text: The group keeps running. Miriam is in front, Theo at Kee’ side, helping her. Jasper looking over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: How far?

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: We’re not going to make it.

dialogues.speaker: END OF THE CLEARING
dialogues.text: The pack of dogs entering the trees.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TREES
dialogues.text: Jasper stops.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: (to Theo) Go! Take the girls! I'11 stay.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What? Theo stops.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: I‘ll be fine, amigo. If I don’t move, they won't do much. Jasper tosses him the backpack. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: Give this to Syd. Go to the road. He's patrolling at this time. When he stops, tell him I sent you. If he doesn’t believe you, tell him he’s a fascist pig! Theo hesitating.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: Go! Miriam nearing the top of the hill, calling back:

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Hurry! Theo starts running again, holding onto Kee.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: Kee! Kee looks back. Jasper standing alone in the woods.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: It’s going to be groovy! Kee smiles, Theo pulling her along. Miriam has reached th top of the hill.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Come ont

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TREES
dialogues.text: WOOF! WOOF! The pack of dogs running through the woods, drunk on their hunting instinct...

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER AHEAD
dialogues.text: Jasper picks up a branch. Gets his grip. Holds his ground

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: (to himself) Goodbye, Ruby Tuesday, who could hang a name on you... Watching the pack of dogs charging...

dialogues.speaker: ON TOP OF THE HILL
dialogues.text: Theo and Kee have made it to the top. He turns to see, barely visible at a distance, mostly obscured by trees:  74. IN THE TREES’ The first dog leaps at Jasper. He swings his branch, hitt the dog backwards. Immediately, the other three dogs attack, the victorious frenzy of the pack bringing down its prey.

dialogues.speaker: ON TOP OF THE HILL
dialogues.text: Theo blocks Kee’s view of this, leading her to the other of the hill. Ahead of them, Miriam is nearing the road. They run to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo and Kee catch up to Miriam on the side of the road, An IMMIGRATION POLICE HUMVEE appears from around the curv bearing down, headlights shining on them.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Is that Syd?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I don‘t know.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: What do we do? The SPOTLIGHT turns on, glaring on them...

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Back, go back --= They start running back to the woods. The Humvee stops. A BORDER COP climbs out, pointing his gun.

dialogues.speaker: STOP.
dialogues.text: The group is lit by the spotlight, just short of the wood

dialogues.speaker: BORDER COP
dialogues.text: Stop, I'll shoot you. Theo stops with Kee, Miriam still running.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Stop -- stop! Miriam finally stops, the three of them standing still. Waiting. Panting. The rumbling of the Humvee engine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And the footsteps of the Border Cop as he steps through t grass, approaching them, pointing his gun...

dialogues.speaker: BORDER COP
dialogues.text: Let’s see your hands... They raise their hands, Theo holding up Jasper’s backpack

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: This is from Jasper --

dialogues.speaker: BORDER COP
dialogues.text: Drop it!

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Jasper said --

dialogues.speaker: BORDER COP
dialogues.text: Drop it or I'1l shoot you! A beat.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You’re a fascist pig --

dialogues.speaker: BORDER COP
dialogues.text: What did you say? The Border Cop advances, his gun point blank in Theo’s fa

dialogues.speaker: BORDER COP
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You're a fascist pig. The Border Cop cracks a big smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Humvee parked on the side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: SYD, (OFF)
dialogues.text: (laughs) .--that's what he used to call me, “corrupt fascist pig.” Last century, they used the word “fascist” a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SYD (the Border Cop) sits up front, smoking a cigarette. 50’s, thick-bodied, life-long cop. He loves his mother bu would sell her for the right price. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: syYD Wiggy old bastard. He was so proud of his weed. Always asking more than it was worth. JERRY -- pimply border cop, 30 -~ sits beside him. He pul a brick of marijuana out of the backpack and hands it to Theo, Kee and Miriam sit in back, behind metal meshing.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: Could get the same shit - way cheaper - from the Zeds, but Syd liked buying from him. Straight chap, a true gentleman. God bless him. Kee MOANS with sudden pain. She shoots a look of alarm at Miriam.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: What’s with the Zed? She sick?

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Nothing. Miriam takes Kee’s hand, reassuring.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: She’s not going to puke, is she?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Can‘t wash out puke. Smell never goes away -

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: She’s fine. At a distance, we see a BUS approaching.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: Usually it’s people trying to get out of Bexhill, not in. Syd doesn’t know why you want to get in, Syd doesn’t wanna to know, Syd doesn’t care. When they release you, stroll out with the rest of the detainees. You'll see a statue of a soldier. Syd will contact Marichka. She’s an Arab, gypsy or something. Syd will tell her to meet you there. She’ll arrange fine accommodations for the evening. Syd opens the door. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: You‘’re Foogies now. So show Syd a big sad face, come on, let’s see them... (show them a sad face) c'mon, sad Foogie face. And don’t speak English.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: No such thing as an English foogie.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: Jerry’s right. Through the window, a bus approaches down the road.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: It's been Syd‘s privilege to serve you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Syd gets out of the Humvee, raising his arms to stop the

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BACK OF THE HUMVEE --
dialogues.text: Theo looks at Kee with concern.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (to Miriam) Is she okay?

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: She had a contraction. (off his look) It’s normal. Syd opens their door.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: All right, Foogies. Out! Move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo slides out of the Humvee, helping Kee down, Miriam following. Walking to the “IMMIGRATION CONTROL” bus -- an old school bus, painted over, the windows covered with ba The driver is inside, an armed guard next to him. A steel cage behind the driver.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: Go on, get in. Theo, Kee and Miriam step on:  78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The steel cage door opens. Theo, Kee and Miriam step in. The cage door closes behind them. They start making their way down the aisle, looking for a seat. Forlorn, malnourished, desperate, trapped faces of captur refugees stare back at them. fhe bus lurches, driving forward. Kee moans with the sudd jolt. Theo steadies her. Miriam finds an empty seat.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Here. They help Kee into a seat, Miriam sitting by the window. Theo sits across the aisle. Through the window, he sees: and his Humvee, receding behind them. Theo feels a yank on his shirt. He turns: it’s a withered old COUPLE, filthy, pitiful, hungry. The Old Woman puts h fingers to her mouth, the universal plea for food, speaki in a language Theo cannot understand, probably German. Theo shrugs. He has nothing to offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus travelling along road. The lights of the city ahe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kee reacts to a shooting pain.

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: (in pain) Uhh! Other refugees turn. Theo realizes they’re drawing attent

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: _ (whispers to Miriam) You sure this is normal?

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: (quietly) Shouldn't be this frequent. She’s only in her eight month. (to Kee) Breathe through them. Just breathe.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Can‘t fuckin’ breathe --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Theo looks outside: the bus stops at a Check Point illuminated with spotlights. One bus already ahead of the

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Miriam... I’m all wet. Water drips down her leg, forming a tiny puddle on the fl

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Her water broke. This baby’s coming.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: She can’t have the baby now.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: (glares at Theo) That’s very insightful. Kee reacts to the beginning of a new contraction.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: (gritting) Uhhh...

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Just breathe, sweetie. Everything is perfect. (to Theo) How long to get there?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: They‘re checking a bus ahead of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our bus is parked behind another bus. The Check Point is wired off with a major steel fence, trimmed with razor wi From the bus in front, Police violently yank off three refugees, vicious dogs barking at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kee breathing through a contraction.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I don't know. Theo looks to see: the Police pushing the three refugees, forcing them to their knees. The three refugees pleading. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dogs barking, One of the Police hits a refugee with a rif butt. The man collapses. Another Police kicks the refugee The overhead lamps turn ON, shining harsh light. Kee is still breathing through her contraction. Two Policeman enter our bus. The lst Policeman is holding dog, walking slowly down the aisle, checking the faces of refugees. A 2nd Policeman follows. Some refugees react Kee’s labored breathing, looking back her. Theo and Miriam share a look of concern.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Shhh.... The ist Policeman glares at a Refugee, who averts his fac

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Look up! (no response from Refugee) Look up, you shit! The 1st Policeman pulls the Refugee up by his hair.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Out! .

dialogues.speaker: REFUGEE
dialogues.text: (pleading) Pieta’, pieta’, no, no, no, ti prego, un po’ di compassione... The 1st Policeman keeps walking. The 2nd Policeman yanks Refugee out of his seat, dragging by his hair to the fron the bus, pushing him off. The Refugee is shoved into the group of kneeling refugees. In the bus, the dog starts barking. Theo, Miriam and Kee tense, as the dog drags the lst Policeman forward. The do is in now front of Kee, barking at her, smelling somethin has never smelled before. The lst Policeman looks at Kee: she is breathing hard, clutching the tube of the seat in front of her, looking a the floor, in the middle of a contraction.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with her? Miriam is frozen. The dog barking. The Policeman yanks Ke up by her hair, twisting her face toward him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: (angry) I said, what’s wrong with her? Kee's contorted face, her eyes wide, wet, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: {with an accent) Caca. The Policeman turns to Theo.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Caca. Caca, piss. Theo points to the floor. The Policeman sees the puddle.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Caca, piss, girl, big mess. Smell!

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: (recoiling slightly) Smell it yourself. The Policeman yanks the leash, but the dog keeps barking Kee, not wanting to move.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: (yanking harder) Snoopy. The Policeman walks past, heading off the bus. Miriam loo at Theo with relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus rumbles to life, lurching forward, heading throug steel fenced corridor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out the window, we see the corridor, fenced in steel, reinforced with razor wire, hopeless faces looking throug the gaps... The BEXHILL FENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus is parked. Refugees pile out, guard dogs barking their heels. Theo and Miriam helping Kee down.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It‘s a chaos.of people. Guards wield night sticks, herdin the group to the final gate. Approaching the threshold, Theo sees a sign framing the g “ACCEPTANCE IS ENDURANCE”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo, Kee and Miriam emerge from the gate, looking around disoriented, lost. This is Bexhill. What used to be an industrial port town now a sealed-off refugee camp, barely lit by occasional street lamps with uneven current. Kee suddenly stops, doubling up -- a new contraction. The flow of refugees keeps pushing behind them, pushing them forward, Kee stopping pain --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODY HELL
dialogues.text: Miriam holding Kee for support.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: (urgent) She‘’s about to deliver this baby. A man walking past, looking at them curiously. Pale skin, knit cap, hook nose. Theo sees: the statue of a soldier.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Wait here. Theo heads to the statue, a WWI soldier holding a bayonet rifle, charging. The plaque reads: “Lost Generation.” The walks around the pedestal. YAP! YAP! A tiny runt dog nips at his heels, scaring the hell out of him.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Shit... Theo turns to see a woman: MARICHKA. Olive skin, 40, the exhausted eyes of someone who accepts the hardship of lif fate. She knows when to duck.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Marichka?  83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo helps Kee into a motorized rickshaw, Miriam already sitting in back. Marichka sits in front, wrapped in a old wool coat, the dog on her lap. Miriam looks back anxiously. Theo turns and sees the Hook Nosed man walking towards them.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You know him?

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: I might. Let's go. (to Marichka) Go! Marichka revs the rickshaw into motion. Through the back window: the Hook-Nosed man runs after them, but he can’t catch the accelerating rickshaw. He recedes behind them.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: A few months ago, one of the Bexhill fences was blown up. A big group of Foogies stampeded through the hole.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I saw the news.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: The Foogie escape was a only smoke screen. What we were actually doing was smuggling some of our people inside. To organize cells.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Smoke screen killed lots of Foogies.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: I know, but it was Luke’s plan. He believed we needed strong cells in Bexhill. He called them missionaries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rickshaw crosses through the dark streets. Small, jur rigged plastic tents around the sidewalks. People warming their hands around scattered piles of burning rubbish -- watching suspiciously at the passing rickshaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kee coming out of a painful contraction, Theo and Miriam supporting her on either side. Kee looks at Miriam.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: This gonna hurt, yeh?

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rickshaw parks in front of a building, trash piled ar the street. Marichka gets off, leading them into a doorwa The sounds of dogs howling and arguing in the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog hopping up the stairs, Marichka next, holding a butane lantern, leading them up the dark stairwell. Kee stops suddenly, holding herself against the wall, in pain

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Breathe through it...

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: One more flight... Marichka starts prattling to them in a language they cann understand, possibly Romanian --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on sweetie, you have to make it. The baby is telling you he wants to come out.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Can she make it?

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: (defiant) She can make it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The contraction passes. Kee nods. Theo and Miriam help he up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. The little dog scampers inside, uses a ch as a springboard, leaps onto the table, and through the broken window yaps his presence to the dogs barking outsi Theo and Miriam help Kee into the room. Marichka sets the butane lamp on the table. The room is naked, peeling wall broken window panes, a rough mat on the floor. Cold enoug to see your breath. Miriam immediately pulls the mat to the center of the roo Kee doubles up with another contraction --

dialogues.speaker: REE
dialogues.text: Fuck all! Marichka trying to explain something they cannot understa pointing at 2 BUCKETS of water, the dog yapping and yappi

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: (to Theo) Make her go. Miriam plucks a shard of glass from the broken window. Th goes to Marichka, turning her toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Thank you, Marichka, we appreciate your help... that‘ll be all... Kee holds herself on the table, moaning with the pain. Miriam dips the glass shard into the bucket -- breaking a thin layer of ice covering the water, cleaning the shard. Marichka turns, pointing at Kee, agitated, prattling on. Miriam gives Theo the glass shard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold this. Get her out!

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: {escorting Marichka out) She’s fine, she’s fine, just ate something funny... Marichka is outside the door, taking out a candle.

dialogues.speaker: MARICHKA
dialogues.text: Santo! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The little dog gets his final yap in, jumps off the table joining his master. Miriam helps Kee down onto the mat.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: We're going to lay down now. Slowly. Kee kneels onto the mat with Miriam’s help.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Don’t push yet. Marichka lighting the candle, still talking as she starts down the stairs with Santo. Theo closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Give me your flask. Theo looks at her, confused.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Your flask, get your flask! Theo takes the flask from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Open it. Still pinching the shard of glass, Theo unscrews the flas top. Miriam holds out her hands.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Pour. Theo pours the alcohol on Miriam’s hands. Kee moans in pa

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: (reassuring Kee -- and herself) This is it. Everything is fine. All we have to do is flow through it. Miriam dipping her hands into the bucket of water. ‘ MIRIAM (to Theo) Give me your shirt. Theo pulls off his coat, unbuttoning his shirt, still pinching the shard of glass. He hands Miriam his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Sterilize your hands. And the glass. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Theo takes a quick, small drink from his flask. Then pour the rest of the alcohol over his hands and the glass shar Miriam goes to Kee, who is laying on the mat, clutching, grabbing -- agony.

dialogues.speaker: NOOOO
dialogues.text: Miriam kneels by Kee’s legs, pushing away her dress, putt Theo’s shirt under her. Seeing:

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: She’s completely dilated. (to Theo) Hurry! Theo finishes cleaning his hands in the bucket.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: (to Theo) Put the glass on the scarf. Get behind her. Kneel. Theo obeys, clumsy -- he has no idea what to do.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Her head -- take her head. (Theo complies) On your lap, let it rest. Kee screaming, in the throes...

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Take her hands! Theo takes her hands, but Kee writhes, pulling them away.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Grab them! Theo takes Kee’s hands more forcefully.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: I can’t ~- I can’t do this!

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Trust your body. Your body knows what to do. Now push.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: I can’t fucking do it!

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Push.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Push. Kee pushes -- her hot breath visible in the cold room.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Beautiful. Just like that. Keep breathing. Again. Now push. Harder. Kee pushes with all her might.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Good. Gather your strength. Grab him. Kee clutches Theo's hands harder -- although we can see h breath, she is covered in sweat.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Good job, Theo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Ahum.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Push. Kee pushes -~ her breath visible.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Yes... That’s it, just like that. Again. Kee pushes -- a round object appears, emerging from blood the vagina expanding... Miriam witnesses this, utterly amazed...

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Oh, Lord. There he is. Kee screams -- excruciating pain -- fear.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: I can't! I can’t! I can’t!

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: All the women who have ever given birth are with you right now. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They are with you Kee. (firm) Push. Kee pushes -- the head impossibly stretching open the vag coming through...

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Push. Theo holding onto Kee, blown away.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (awkward) You’re doing great. Kee looks up at Theo, her face wet with sweat and tears, little reassured. Miriam watches: the baby’s blue head emerges completely..

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: The head’s out. My God, look at that. (urgent) Push, Kee.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Push. Kee pushing -- the rest of the baby’s body flowing out in stream of blood, Miriam supporting the emerging mass...

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Here he comes, here he comes... Kee pushing mightily, Theo barely able to hold her hands

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: You're nearly there... Kee screaming her extraordinary effort, tapping the reser of female strength, giving her body over to the new life coming through it, to life itself, the miracle --

dialogues.speaker: FUCKING GOD
dialogues.text: -- the baby bursts forth, a bloody explosion of life... Miriam pulling it free, still hooked by the umbilical cor the placenta spilling out in a final bloody exclamation ~ There is a moment, a pause. Theo holding Kee. Both of the looking to Miriam. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: For the first time in eighteen years, four months, two da sixteen hours and eight minutes, a human child has been b Miriam holds the newborn baby, all blue, covered in white specks, giving off steam in the cold room.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: It’s a girl.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: How's my baby?

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: She’s perfect. Theo, come.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Lemme see her! Theo lays Kee back down on the mat. Moving to Miriam.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: (gestures to her scarf) Take the glass. Theo takes the glass shard off the scarf.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: cut it.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: The cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: What‘s you doing? Gimme my baby!

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: In a moment. Theo hesitates with the glass shard.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: It doesn’t hurt. Theo puts the glass against the umbilical cord and SLICES The cord splits, spurting a bit of blood. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Miriam yanks off one of her bracelets, gives it to Theo.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Tie it. Here. Any knot will do. Theo ties off the umbilical cord with the string bracelet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What’s wrong? She okay?

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: She’s beautiful. (to Theo) Get the shirt. Theo takes the shirt from under Kee and hands it to Miria She cleans the white, cheese-like residue from the baby. Theo watches, freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Scarf. Open it. Theo opens the scarf. Miriam expertly wraps the baby in i

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Aren't they supposed to cry?

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: She‘ll cry. When she’s hungry. Now, she wants Mommy.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Fuckin ‘a. Miriam offers the wrapped baby to Kee. Theo returns to hi spot, supporting Kee from behind. Kee accepts her child, holding her, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Hey you...my boo, bloo...watch at you... The baby CRIES, a strident, rhythmic scream that shatters night. Theo looks at Miriam, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Show her where your breast is. Kee puts the baby to her breast. Instinctively, the child suckles, extracting the milk hungrily. Kee watches, amaze

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Cheedo, eh?  92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dim light shining from a window. Inside, Theo, Miriam a Kee ~~ beholding this new life. Surrounded by the black night. It's silent. Even the dogs have stopped barking. FADE OUT. The sound of distant HELICOPTERS... sporadic GUNSHOTS... blending with the sound of YAPPING, coming closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo opens his eyes, waking up on the floor, his coat pul over him, getting his bearings: The first morning sun finding its way into the naked room Kee still sleeping on the mat, the baby at her chest. Mir seated next to Kee, asleep. YAP! YAP! The tiny barking sound is now outside the door. Footsteps following. Theo creakily gets to his feet. There’s a PUSH on the door -~ but a chair is wedged again the handle inside, keeping it shut. A decisive knocking o the door, the YAPPING growing frantic... Kee and Miriam open their eyes, awakening.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: (outside the door) Open the door! Kee and Miriam look to Theo.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: (outside) We don’t have much time -- open the bloody door! A harder push on the door-- the chair slides, about to gi

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Who is it? syYD It’s the Queen of England, can you spare a cup of sugar? It’s Syd, you fool. Open the door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Miriam wraps the cloak around Kee, hiding the baby. More pushing on the door, the chair sliding...

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Okay, okay... In the distance, a staccato burst of gunfire is heard. Theo takes away the chair, cracks the door. He peers into the hall: a man stands there, wearing nondescript clothes a turban -~ it takes moment to recognize Syd. Marichka behind him, Santo jumping, trying to get in the room.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Didn't know you were coming.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: Didn’t you hear the bomb last night? The city’s gone to hell. Come on, let Syd in. Syd has already pushed through the door. Miriam holds Kee tighter. Santo is now running around inside, yelping. Marichka follows. Theo immediately closes the door. Syd looks at the residue from the night before: the blood mat, the bloody clothing... .

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: What’s with the Zed?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Nothing. She’s fine. Some woman’s thing. Santo is on the scent, sniffing at Kee, yelping.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: A few hours ago one of the fences got blown up, and a group of Foogies escaped. It didn’t take long for other Foogies to follow, your regular stampede. The army came in, they’re trying to secure the fence. Just like five months ago, but worse. Now those Foogies are better organized, and Syd happens to know they’re armed to the teeth. It’s gonna be a fucking war out there. We got to get you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: We need to get a boat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Santo keeps yapping at Kee.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: (to dog) Go on, piss off. Santo won't leave. Kee kicks him. Santo yelps, retreating Marichka starts yelling at Kee in some language. Then -- CRYING. From the baby. Rhythmic, loud. The dog comes charging again...

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Get your fuckin’ dog! Kee kicks the dog again.

dialogues.speaker: MARICHRA
dialogues.text: Santo! Marichka grabs her dog. The baby still crying loudly. Kee puts the baby to her breast. The baby calms, suckling.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: The hell was that? Santo still yapping in Marichka’s arms. Marichka gives Sa a little slap, shutting the dog up. Quiet -- except for t moist suckling of the baby.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I’1l explain --

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: What you got there? Let Syd see it.

dialogues.speaker: NOW
dialogues.text: Miriam eases, the cloak from Kee's shoulder. Revealing th BABY, suckling at Kee’s breast.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: Bloody Christ. Marichka approaches. Kneeling, seeing the baby, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: It’s a fucking baby. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: We need a boat. Syd starts pacing.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (insists) We need it before sunset --

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: Hush! Hush! Syd’s trying to think here! Marichka reaches her finger. She looks to Kee, who nods h permission. Marichka touches the baby. Her face lights up her eyes well with tears ~~ she has touched a miracie.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: Okay, okay... Get her up. We’ve got to go right now.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Can you get us a boat -- ?

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: Sure, sure, sure. Just get her up! Come on, do it! Theo moves to the mat. With her shawl, Miriam finishes securing the baby to Kee’s breast. Outside, another burst gunfire, closer. Together, they gently help Kee up. Marichka turns to Syd, talking at him, prattling on, adam

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What’s she saying?

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: Fuck knows. Marichka turns to Theo, Miriam and Kee, prattling on, urg Syd pulls out a two-way radio.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: {into radio) We're ready, Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Who's Jerry?

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: You met him. Pimply bloke. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Marichka insists, grabbing Syd’s sleeve, prattling on --

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: Shut up! (in Romanian) “Bastal” Syd throws Marichka off.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: MARICHKA
dialogues.text: Not (points to Syd) Bad! Bad, badi

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: She doesn’t want us to go. Syd pulls out a gun. Marichka instinctively ducks to the floor, covering her head, her hands pleading. syD Okay, move. Let’s go. The group is frozen.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Where are you taking us?

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: Syd said move! Miriam walks to the door, blocking it.

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: We're not leaving. We can’t leave, Syd. Not until the baby’s safety is guaranteed. A standoff. In the distance, mob shouts are heard.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: Move!

dialogues.speaker: MIRIAM
dialogues.text: I will not. BANG! Syd shoots Miriam in the head. She falls in the doorway, dead. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kee lets out a wail of horror, her knees buckling. Theo holds her. Marichka still cowering.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: (points his gun) Who’s next, the Yank or the gypsy? Maybe the fucking dog? BANG! Syd shoots the floor by Santo’s feet. The dog yelps scampering for Marichka’s protection. Kee glares at Syd.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: (spits the words) You fuckin’ caca man. Syd points his gun at Theo’s forehead.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: Move. Seeing no way out, Theo looks at Kee.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I’1l help you.

dialogues.speaker: GOING DOWN THE STAIRS -
dialogues.text: Marichka leads them, Theo carries Kee in his arms, Syd following with his gun. Marichka still prattling on.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: Last night, Syd gets home, mommy's sleeping in front of the telly. She always does that, my sweet soul. Syd kisses her good-night. She has cancer, my mommy. Syd‘’s about to turn off the telly -- and there’s your mugs. On the news. You nasty pricks gunning down those cops -- bam! bam! Big reward. Marichka is ranting even louder, Santo yapping. ° SYD Shut the fuck up! {into radio) Jerry, you on your way?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (on radio) I had to go around a barricade. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: (into radio) Just hurry the fuck up. (to Theo) Then Jerry calls Syd. The Fishes in Bexhill are looking for you. So Syd thinks, the cops are looking for them, the Fishes are looking for them, these blokes are bang-up commodities. And a baby? That‘’s capital. (into radio) Where the fuck are you, Jerry? The group arrives at the ground floor. Theo lets Kee down both resting on a cold radiator, catching their breath, Marichka next to them. Syd holds the gun on the them as the goes to entrance to investigate. The entrance has no doors, Marichka’s ricksh visible on the street outside. sYD (on radio) Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Syd, please, listen.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: Shut up. Theo watches Syd, still pointing the gun behind him, but attention wavering to the street in front.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (on radio) I can see the building.

dialogues.speaker: SYD
dialogues.text: Good. Come around to the front -- Theo makes his move, charging across the lobby. Syd hears him coming, turns... Theo FALLS OVER a rusted pipe that saves his life -- BANG! Syd‘s shot just misses Theo’s head. Theo's fail carries him into Syd’s legs, knocking him backwards. Syd’s head bangs the floor, the radio flying.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Go! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kee gets it. She clutches Marichka for support, pointing the front door. Marichka gets it, helping Kee to the door

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (on radio) I'm here! I’m right out front. SMASH! An personnel carrier rolls up, crushing Marichka’s rickshaw. Marichka stops, reverses herself, helping Kee b across the lobby, passing Theo crawling toward Syd. Syd, coming out of his daze, trying to point his gun, but Theo reaches, grabbing his gun hand. Marichka helping Kee into a CORRIDOR at the end of the lo Theo on top of Syd, struggling with his hand, Syd biting Theo's head.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (screams) Abhhhh! Theo's hand forcing the gun away, pressuring the trigger BANG! BANG! BANG! The gun fires into the wall, plaster falling, until it the chamber CLICKS. CLICK. CLICK. Empty From the corridor, Marichka and Kee look back, reacting t the gunshots. Theo pushes Syd away, starting after the women. Syd grabs Theo's legs, tripping him, sending him thudding on the fl the gun sliding away. Syd jumps on Theo, punching his face. He puts his hands around Theo’s throat, squeezing. Theo gasping, reaching, strangling him. From the corridor, Kee urges Marichka back to help.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Go -- go help! Kee against the wall, loosening the scarf, checking her b Marichka reluctantly heading back to the lobby, staying l her hands defensive, prattling urgently, pleading to Syd. Syd keeps tightening his grip around Theo’s neck. Theo's body going slack. Marichka gets closer, still pleading.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Theo’s hand reaches to the gun on the floor, grabbing the barrel, round-housing it -- SMACK! -- into Syd’s face. Sy falls backwards, stunned. Theo pushes himself to his feet, gasping air back into th lungs. Syd recovering, moving toward Theo. Theo kicks Syd in the head. Syd falls backwards, knocked out. Theo, for good measure, kicks Syd in the gut. Theo grabs Marichka, gasping, motioning for them to leave They head down the corridor, joining Kee. They reach a door at the end. It’s blocked with boxes and junk. Theo and Marichka clearing the debris, Theo forcing the door open, just enough space to pass. Behind them:

dialogues.speaker: LOBBY
dialogues.text: Syd groggily crawls to his knees, looking for the gun.

dialogues.speaker: END OF CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Marichka snakes through the narrow door passage, out to a small alley, Santo following. It’s Kee’s turn, but there' not enough space for her to pass with the baby. From the alley, Marichka extends her hands.

dialogues.speaker: MARICHKA
dialogues.text: Baby, Marichka! Kee hesitates, Theo pulling the door open. Behind them:

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Syd finds the gun.

dialogues.speaker: END OF CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Kee passes the baby through the doorway, fearing the wors Marichka takes the baby. The point of no return. A moment Marichka motions for Kee to follow.

dialogues.speaker: MARICHKA
dialogues.text: Come! Ree squeezes through the opening. Theo still holding the door, looking back:

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Syd stumbling toward them, gun in hand, loading bullets.  101.

dialogues.speaker: END OF CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Theo trying to squeeze out, but nobody is helping with th door -- BANG! Syd‘s shot misses, leaving a hole in the metal door Theo throws his body into the door, forcing it open -- BANG! BANG! Shots ripping the door as Theo squeezes throu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo comes out the door into the trash-strewn alley. Kee Marichka waiting, Kee wrapping the scarf, covering the ba to her chest.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (to the women) Go. They start making their way slowly down the alley, Marich holding Kee up. Theo is about to follow, when he hears:

dialogues.speaker: SYD, (OFF)
dialogues.text: (into radio) Jerry, they got loose... go to the back, the alley... Theo realizes Syd is too close. They aren’t going to make it. He looks around, rooting through the trash, desperate Worthless plastic, rotting food, a rusted CLOTHES IRON.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (OFF)
dialogues.text: (into radio) I don’t know, Syd, this is getting bad. I got a 1-24, a gang of frogs in the streets, they’ve got guns, we ought to get out of here... Syd’s face appears at the door. They look at each other f an instant. Syd furiously forcing his way through -- Theo grabs the clothes iron and swings -- CRANK! Into Syd’s face. Syd falls back inside the door. Theo stands, staring at the door, the iron poised, ready. But he quickly understands there’s no need to wait. Theo drops the iron, and rushes after the women.  102.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE END OF THE ALLEY -
dialogues.text: Kee leaning against the wall, gathering her strength, Marichka peering around the edge of the building. Theo arrives, completely winded. “La Marseilles” can be heard, chanted by an approaching mob.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: It hurts. I’m hungry.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (to Marichka, re: Kee) She needs to eat. Marichka prattles some sort of answer. Theo puts his fing to his mouth, the universal sign of hunger.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Food, mange... (points to Kee) Hungry. Marichka nods, getting it, pointing. Theo and Marichka ta on either side of Kee, helping her walk, Santo following. They round the corner onto the street. Pocked and rubbled the streets of Bexhill bear scars of previous violence. A mob marches toward them, more than 50, a large flag billows, blue, white and red.

dialogues.speaker: VOICES
dialogues.text: Alons enfants de la patrie... Theo and Kee and Marichka passing the mob in the opposite direction. Passionate chanting, some wearing masks, all carry guns -- modern semi-automatics, a few old Glocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This street seems quiet, “La Marseilles” now distant. Marichka, gestures, leading them into a bureaucratic buil covered with graffiti. Further down the street, on buildi tops, men with rifles run from roof to roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo, Kee and the baby, Marichka and Santo enter. Dozens old shoes on the floor, neatly paired. They hear CHANTING rhythmic prayers.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It was once a bank, but now just the skeleton remains, a teller counters, some bars along the lobby. Through them: Men kneel on a carpeted floor, bowing toward Mecca in hum prayer. This is a makeshift mosque. They pass by, moving to the stairs at the end of the hall

dialogues.speaker: 2ND FLOOR CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: At the end of the dark corridor, Marichka is bent down at Metal door, talking to someone through a low eye-slit. A tiny flashlight shines through the slit into her face. A trembly voice on the other side of the door, in Russian:

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIAN MAN, (OFF)
dialogues.text: Nyet . At the stairs, foggy light oozes though the filthy window Kee rests on Theo, discerning Marichka across the dark corridor, now waving for them to come, insisting, prattli Theo helps Kee into the dark corridor.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIAN MAN, (OFF)
dialogues.text: Nyet, nyet... As they approach the secure metal door, the flashlight fr the eye slit shines in Theo’s face. Marichka grabs Kee’s cloak. The light shifts to Kee’s fac as she resists, but the cloak opens. The light tilts down shining on the baby, eyes closed, feeding on Kee’s breast From the eye-slit, the flashlight shaking, a gasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pale, withered GEORGIAN WOMAN (87) hums a folk song as carves the final touches onto an orange that she’s cut in swan. She presents the swan to Kee, who lays in bed eatin some sort of potato stew, the baby asleep at her side.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Watch at that. They’re in a simple dwelling that was once a bureaucrat’s office. One table, two chairs, a gas burner, photos, a Chagal reproduction of the cow on the farm. And, in the clean, big windows, a few potted plants, green, living.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Check it out, Theo. They love my baby. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Theo sits at the table, eating stew. Marichka stands near wolfing hers -- she hasn’t eaten this good in awhile. The ancient, dignified GEORGIAN MAN (90’s) sits in a wheelcha speaking in a trembly voice with thick accent.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIAN MAN
dialogues.text: Human Project, is real?

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Yeh. Wise man doctors from todo the world. Living in Iceland. Sent a boat to my baby. “The Tomorrow”. At the buoy.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: We need a boat to meet it. Before sunset. The Georgian Man asks Marichka a question in her language Marichka answers by rubbing her thumb to her fingers, the universal sign for money. .

dialogues.speaker: MARICHKA
dialogues.text: (mouthful of stew) “Bunch of money.”

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIAN MAN
dialogues.text: (in Marichka’s language) “Yeah, yeah, yeah...” The Georgian Man wheels himself toward the bookshelf. Marichka looks at Theo, rubbing her thumb to her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: MARICHKA
dialogues.text: “Bunch of money.” The Georgian Man arrives at the bookshelf, where pantheon busts reside: Lenin, Freud, Einstein, Ghandi, Trotsky, Zapata, and Martin Luther King, Jr. He selects Lenin.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIAN MAN
dialogues.text: (to Theo) Always money. Everything always money. Seeing the owners distracted, Marichka nabs a silver spoo from the table and sneaks it into her shirt. An amplified voice echoes from the street.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (OFF)
dialogues.text: A curfew is now in effect. Theo looks:  105.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: A caravan of armored personal carriers and tanks move slo down the empty streets.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker) Anyone seen on the streets will. be considered hostile and shot. England supports you and provides you shelter. Do not support terrorists. Then the same message, translated into French. On top of building across the street, men in masks armed with rifle run in the opposite direction of the tanks. KEE’S VOICE Watch at that! Watch at Santo and the pussy.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE APARTMENT
dialogues.text: RUFF! Santo barks. HISS! The cat arches. Kee laughs.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Get it on! The Georgian Man rolls back in his wheelchair to the tabl holding the bust of Lenin.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIAN MAN
dialogues.text: We hear Human Project, no believe. Trick, make people hope. (smiles) But is real! The remains of the smile on the old man’s lips as he look his wife, telling her something in Russian. Then:

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIAN MAN
dialogues.text: Human Project!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIAN WOMAN
dialogues.text: (smiles) Human Project. Marichka nods, laughs, pretending like she understands.

dialogues.speaker: MARICHKA
dialogues.text: Human Project! The Georgian Man BREAKS Lenin’s bust on the table. In the porcelain shards: a roll of money. English pounds.  106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marichka stands in the middle of the street, her senses alert. Sporadic gunfire and shouting in the distance, but the street seems safe. She signals, and starts trotting. Theo immediately pushes Kee from the bank in the Georgian Man’s wheelchair. Kee has the baby wrapped against her ch and covered. She’s holding the orange cut like a swan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group in the middle of a street obscured in fog, Theo pushing Kee in the wheelchair, trying to keep up with Marichka’s quick trot, Santo tapping along. A RUMBLING in the street. Santo stops, turns around, and starts barking. The ground begins to shake. They all turn: the street beh them shrouded in fog. Street poles shaking. A mechanical clacking adds to the rumbling, drowning out Santo’s barks Through the fog...a silhouette slowly taking form...mammo

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Shit... The silhouette defines itself as the fog gives way... A TANK. Solid, massive, scary. And it’s damn close, comin right on them. Theo pushes Kee, the group running away from the tank. Marichka looks back: Santo holds his ground, barking at the metal monster. Marichka turns, running back for her dog.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Marichka...! The tank getting bigger, Santo loses his courage, whimper backing off... Marichka grabs the dog. She turns, finding her stride, running back towards the others, trying to catch up...

dialogues.speaker: DOWN BAY STREET
dialogues.text: Theo and Kee come against: a long metal pole wedged in a sewer, fortified by a big mountain of broken concrete and debris blocking the street -- a barricade.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Theo turns the wheelchair, veering off towards:

dialogues.speaker: A NARROW ALLEY
dialogues.text: As soon as Theo and Kee take refuge --

dialogues.speaker: BASQUE MAN
dialogues.text: (in Basque) “Down! Down!” They turn: a man with a machine gun is yelling at them. T are surrounded by other men -- some masked, all of them a -- more guns than the previous mobs. Marichka makes it to the alley, chastising Santo --

dialogues.speaker: BASQUE MAN
dialogues.text: “Get down!” Marichka sizes the situation, and immediately drops to th ground.

dialogues.speaker: BAY STREET
dialogues.text: The tank rolls by, followed by two Armored Personnel Carriers. A metallic CREAK! The tank runs up against the metal barricade pole that holds its ground. A moment. Silence. Just the idling of the tank motor.

dialogues.speaker: NARROW ALLEY
dialogues.text: The Basque men lay in wait.

dialogues.speaker: BAY STREET
dialogues.text: A change of gear -- CREAK! The tank pushes against the barricade pole. The two metal arms wrestling, the tank confident, but the barricade pole will not back down.

dialogues.speaker: NARROW ALLEY
dialogues.text: The Basque Man signals --

dialogues.speaker: BASQUE MAN
dialogues.text: “Now! Now!” The Basque men surge toward the street.  108.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE STREET
dialogues.text: More men surge forward, dragging over the carcass of a bu out car, blocking the way. A flaming bottle hurled froma building explodes against the tank. The ambush is on.

dialogues.speaker: NARROW ALLEY
dialogues.text: Theo gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: We've gotta move. Theo rolls Kee forward, the baby secure against her chest following Marichka. Behind them, through the alley:

dialogues.speaker: BAY STREET
dialogues.text: The carrier doors fly open, soldiers streaming out, screaming, shooting... The fog soon obscures the battle, but not the sound of carnage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KNOCK! KNOCK! Marichka’s hand pounds a weathered door. An eye-slit opens. A man with an extremely pale face, matted hair and wispy whiskers stares out -- the SEWER RAT. The Sewer Rat assesses Theo and Kee as Marichka prattles her language, negotiating. She reaches into her shirt, pulling out the bills that used to be live in Lenin’s hea waving them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3 armored carriers cruise by, disappearing into the fog. The coast clear, the Sewer Rat leads Theo and Kee and Marichka onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Don‘t move! Don’t move! Theo recognizes a man crossing toward them. The Hook-Nose Man. Coming at them, pointing a gun. Marichka immediately drops into her submissive position, the Sewer Rat raises hands. The Hook-Nosed Man whistles -- shrill, distinctive Three masked, armed men come running toward the group. On talking into a radio. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Wharf Street! Now! The armed men surround them. The leader takes his mask of It's Patric. He looks at Theo -- THUD! Patric rifle butts Theo in the gut, knocking him to the ground. Two Fishes holding guns on Kee, Marichka and the Sewer Ra

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: You teenie prick Patric son of the ugliest rotten whore may the devil keep on fist fuckin’ her in hell! A dozen heavily armed men come running from different directions, converging on Theo, Kee and Marichka and the Sewer Rat. Among them, Luke and Ian. Luke approaches Kee.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: You‘1l be protected.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (still on the ground) We need to get to a boat.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: (to the others} Let’s go. One Fish takes Kee’s wheelchair, another Fish flanking, hustling her away. Luke looks at Theo, Marichka and the Sewer Rat.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: (to Patric) Finish them. Luke follows Kee and the Fishes. Patric cocks his pistol. Marichka still on her knees, outstretching her hands...

dialogues.speaker: MARICHKA
dialogues.text: “Please, please, please...” Patric points the gun at Theo -- BAM! BAM! Shots ring out.  110.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN WHARF STREET
dialogues.text: An armored carrier rolls toward them, two soldiers shooti from the turret.

dialogues.speaker: UP WHARF STREET
dialogues.text: Patric retrains his pistol at the soldiers -- BAM! BAM! H open fires. The other Fishes follow suit, a fierce burst gunfire that forces the armored carrier to stop.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Let's go. Ian, hold them off. Luke and Patric run to catch up with Kee.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN WHARF STREET
dialogues.text: Soldiers climb out of the armored carrier, firing rounds.

dialogues.speaker: UP WHARF STREET
dialogues.text: Ian flanked by two men, holding position from behind a doorway. Two other Fishes take a spot across the street. Firing all they’ve got at the carrier. Theo scrambles away from the line of fire.

dialogues.speaker: NEAR THE CORNER
dialogues.text: Theo ducks into a doorway with Marichka, clutching Santo, Sewer Rat following. Theo watches:

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER AHEAD
dialogues.text: Luke and his men pushing Kee, rounding the CORNER onto 3r STREET, escaping the line of fire.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN WHARF STREET
dialogues.text: The street trembles, the poles shaking. The armored carri pulls to the side... Allowing a TANK to pass by. Shielding a group of soldiers, firing on Ian and his men.

dialogues.speaker: UP WHARF STREET
dialogues.text: The heavy barrage forces Ian and his men to retreat. Two Fishes make it to the corner. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1li.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ian and the other two are flushed into open, crossing the street towards the corner -- TAT-TAT-TAT-TAT. Soldier’s gunfire cuts down two of the Fishes. Ian keeps running, swarming bullets smashing concrete. He makes it to the corner. Behind him:

dialogues.speaker: DOWN 3RD STREET
dialogues.text: Luke and the other Fishes fleeing.

dialogues.speaker: WHARF STREET DOORWAY
dialogues.text: Theo watching Kee being rolled away. He turns to the Sewe Rat and Marichka, who is crouched in a protective positio

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Stay. Understand? (using his hands) You stay. You wait. Here. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: MARICHKA
dialogues.text: (nods) Marichka, stay. Theo looks to his left:

dialogues.speaker: THE CORNER
dialogues.text: Ian holding the position with two men, shooting, unable t stop the advancing tank.

dialogues.speaker: TAN
dialogues.text: (to the men) Go! The two men peel off after Luke. Ian fires a few more rounds, then follows.

dialogues.speaker: WHARF STREET DOORWAY
dialogues.text: Theo looks to his right:

dialogues.speaker: DOWN WHARF STREET
dialogues.text: The tank advancing, the soldiers marching, holding fire, their weapons trained on the corner, focused.

dialogues.speaker: WHARF STREET DOORWAY
dialogues.text: Theo sucks it up, gathering his courage. He storms out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhbh!

dialogues.speaker: WHARF STREET
dialogues.text: Theo screaming his way into the open.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: ’ Ahhbhhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: DOWN WHARF STREET
dialogues.text: The soldiers, their focus on the corner broken by the screaming man, are caught off guard, a double-take before reacting, firing away.

dialogues.speaker: WHARF STREET
dialogues.text: Theo screaming his way across, bullets ricochet and crash making it to:

dialogues.speaker: CORNER
dialogues.text: Theo shields himself against the wall, catching his breat He looks towards:

dialogues.speaker: 3RD STREET
dialogues.text: Ian and his men chase after Luke and the Fishes fleeing w Kee.

dialogues.speaker: CORNER
dialogues.text: Theo sucks a breath, and runs after them.

dialogues.speaker: 3RD STREET
dialogues.text: Ian notices Theo running behind. He stops and shoots at h Theo twists away, running for cover, diving behind a stoo

dialogues.speaker: UP 3RD STREET
dialogues.text: An armored carrier emerges from the fog, cutting off the Fishes’ escape. They stop. Ian stops shooting at Theo, running to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: CORNER
dialogues.text: The tank making the turn.  113.

dialogues.speaker: UP 3RD STREET
dialogues.text: Pinched between the Carrier and the tank, Luke gestures, leading Kee and the Fishes towards the modern apartment b in front of them. Ian catching up.

dialogues.speaker: STOOP
dialogues.text: Theo gets up, starts running after the Fishes.

dialogues.speaker: UP 3RD STREET
dialogues.text: Soldiers climbing out of the carrier, shooting at Luke an the Fishes pushing Kee’s wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT BLOCK
dialogues.text: Luke, and the Fishes make it the building, hoisting the wheelchair up the few stairs, rolling her inside.

dialogues.speaker: CORNER
dialogues.text: The tank making it around. The soldiers follow. As they g a clear shot --

dialogues.speaker: 3RD STREET
dialogues.text: TAT-TAT-TAT-TAT! One of Ian’s men is shot in the back. Theo halts, veering back, running towards a burned-out do decker, abandoned on the sidewalk across the street from apartment block. He dives through the back door, knocking away the cardboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
