dialogues.text: Theo falls on top of people huddled inside. Spanish screa of fear as bodies scramble away. Theo gets to his feet. He’s just crashed into a densely packed living quarter, makeshift mats crammed across the a burner in the middle. People crouching for cover, a few peering through the cardboard covering the windows. He goes to one, pulling back a piece of cardboard:

dialogues.speaker: 3RD STREET
dialogues.text: Soldiers emerge from the 2nd Carrier, taking position beh its metallic bulk, starting to shoot... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ian and the last Fish make it to apartment block, bullets exploding the concrete facade, the doorway shattering as disappear into the darkness within. The tank and the soldiers arrive next to the armored carr positioned in front of the building. Soldiers surge from behind tank and the armored carrier, men, charging towards:

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT BLOCK DOORWAY
dialogues.text: The soldiers run through the shattered doorway into the building, of their footsteps receding in the darkness... A MOMENT. BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! Through the darkness, fierce flashes of gunfire. Screams. Soldiers stagger back out of the doorway, some wounded, running in full retreat from the bullets flying from insi BLAM! BLAM! The escaping soldiers are gunned down from behind. One lone soldier runs desperately, diving behind carrier, safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stray bullets strafe the bus, people diving to the floor. Theo keeps low, still peering out the cardboard window.

dialogues.speaker: 3RD STREET
dialogues.text: Soldiers shielded behind the tank and armored cars return fire, riddling the door. Other soldiers remove steel shie from the side of the carrier, taking positions behind the

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT BLOCK
dialogues.text: A GRENADE comes flying out. 3RD STREET — The grenade lands in a cluster of soldiers setting up met shields -- BAM! The soldiers are blown away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grenade shrapnel rips through the cardboard. A woman taki refuge in the corner is hit in the head.  115.

dialogues.speaker: 3RD STREET
dialogues.text: The soldiers open fire on the 2nd floor window. The big t gun ratchets up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo watches through the cardboard window.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: No, no, no, no...

dialogues.speaker: 3RD STREET
dialogues.text: KA-BOOM. The tank recoils with the blast as the 2nd floor window explodes, a concussive blow that rips a gaping sca the side of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo reacts to the blast.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Shit. He shakes it off, making his way to the end of the bus. People screaming, crying, covering up. Theo stepping over them, around them, getting to the front. Through the wind

dialogues.speaker: 3RD STREET
dialogues.text: Soldiers fire at the 2nd floor. From the 4th floor, white sheets and clothes wave from windows, desperate pleas for mercy from tenants trapped i the building. From a 5th floor window, a Fish fires down on the soldier Other Fishes shoot from different windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo steps off the bus. A zone of hell -- armored carrier and soldiers -- separate him from the apartment block. Bullets flying from all directions. Theo runs behind the soldiers, whose attention is focused shooting the building to pieces, and heads to the far edg the square in front of the apartment block, making it to:

dialogues.speaker: A CONCRETE BARRICADE
dialogues.text: Theo shields himself behind it. Across:  116.

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT BLOCK PLAZA
dialogues.text: The facade of the building falling to pieces. Tenants streaming out the front doors, hands in the air, screamin surrender in a dozen languages -- TAT-TAT-TAT-TAT. Soldier‘’s gun fire cuts down the fleein tenants. A few survivors retreat back into the building. The tank targets its big gun at a 4th floor window where shots are coming... KA-BOOM. The tank mortar obliterates the window. In the momentary silence of the aftershock...

dialogues.speaker: CONCRETE BARRICADE
dialogues.text: Theo sucks a breath, gathers his courage, makes his break

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT BLOCK PLAZA
dialogues.text: Theo in the open, running toward the doorway, side-steppi the bodies of dead soldiers and tenants.

dialogues.speaker: 3RD STREET
dialogues.text: The soldiers, busy with the windows, are slow in clocking Theo running from the periphery. But the docrway is still distant for Theo, and some soldiers aim at him, firing aw

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT BLOCK PLAZA
dialogues.text: The bullets ricochetting and whizzing past Theo‘’s head a his feet, still not close to the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: 3RD STREET
dialogues.text: More soldiers notice Theo, shooting at him.

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT BLOCK DOORWAY
dialogues.text: Bullets kick up debris around Theo. The doorway getting closer, he sidesteps the bodies of soldiers and tenants. 5 steps separate him from the jagged hole that is the doo He slips on the blood-slicked cement, falling hard, bulle ripping, fallen bodies all around, some getting more shot He crawls in panic. A final desperate lunge across blood, glass and debris. Guardian angels working overtime, he crosses the threshold of the door.  117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo crawling at top speed across the dark corridor splattered with rubble and dead bodies, bullets echoing a ricochetting around the walls. And now gunfire coming at him from the inside: the hook-n leaves his position, storming after Theo. Theo shields himself behind pillar, the hook-nosed coming him, shooting. Bullets from the outside ricochet through the corridor, clipping the hook-nosed man in the head. He falls dead. Theo gasps for breath. The soldiers’ attack on the doorwa slowly diminishes, giving way to gunfire from within. Across the corridor, he sees a man and a woman huddle beh a pillar. He slowly gets up. Cautiously making his way through bodies and debris to the stairs. At the foot of the stairs: Kee’s discarded wheelchair. Th starts climbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo arrives at the landing, looking down the hallway. A tenants huddled in the dim shadows, staying low, keeping from the windows. A man cries in agony, splashing the pud of his own blood. But the heavy gunfire comes from upstai He continues up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo gets to the floor, peering down the hallway. Tenants the floor, covering their heads, a few wounded, screaming some bullets make it through the apartment, crashing into hall walls. Theo steps into:

dialogues.speaker: 3RD FLOOR HALLWAY
dialogues.text: He walks through the hallway and looks into an apartment where a gun is being shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three tenants lay dead on the floor. At the window, Patri fires down at the soldiers below. Immediately, he retreat from the window, as bullets from outside rip through the room, rushing toward the door.  118.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo retreats to the stairway landing, hiding as -- Patric storms out of the apartment, goes down the hall, disappearing into another apartment. A moment. Fresh gun shots are heard. Patric runs out, soldiers bullets rippin through the apartment. He heads farther down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: PATRIC
dialogues.text: (pushing past tenants) Fuck outta my way, fuck outta my way! Patric kicks open the door of another apartment. Theo notices: the orange cut like a swan, a few steps abo him, smashed. He continues up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo steps into the corridor. A tank mortar has ripped op a gaping hole in the building. People huddle in the hallw the wounded, the terrified, the dead. Theo walks through the hallway, reaching the mortar hole. Soldiers’ bullets scream through the opening, shattering wall, spewing debris. He considers crossing before backin off, returning to the stairs. Then he hears it. A BABY’S CRY. A weak wail through the chaos and explosion Coming from the end of the corridor. Separated by the gap mortar hole, where bullets crash through. Theo edges up to the mortar-ripped hole. Sporadic bullets smashing the wall. He sucks a breath. And runs. It’s only ten feet, but it feels like a mile, the shots ringing pas He makes it to the other side. He continues down the hall The baby’s cries louder. Tenants huddled in the hallway, peering up warily, not quiet believing what they are hear Loud cries, coming from an apartment. Theo steps into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place has been shredded by bullets, glass shattered, everything upended. Kee in a corner, protecting her baby girl with her body. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Luke lays by ‘the window in a pool of his own blood, with back toward Kee, sniping out the window. In his other han he shouts instructions on a radio.

dialogues.speaker: . LURE
dialogues.text: ++-get ready to blow the south gate. The South gate. We're coming out. : With Luke’s distraction, Theo makes it over to Kee. The b is visible on her chest, still crying.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Yeh.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: How is she?

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Pissed off. Theo leans down to Kee, helping her up.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (to Kee) Easy. We're going to make it. Bullets from outside RIDDLE the wall near them.’ Theo cov Kee with his body. The shooting passes. At the window, Luke responds, shooting rounds outside. Theo and Kee making their way across the ruined room to t door. Theo steps on glass, a cracking sound -- Luke turns and sees them. He points the gun. Theo freezes

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I carried her out of the wheelchair, and I started crying. The baby. A girl.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s a girl.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I forgot what they looked like.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: We need to get her out of here.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: No, no, no. You don’t understand, Faron. It's happening. I did what Julian couldn't. I called for the national uprising. And the people have responded. Not only here. All over England. I made it happen. They follow me. Theo slowly keeps leading Kee to the doorway, wary of Luk who sites him with his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Stop, Faron. This child stays with us. It’s our flag.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Fuck she is! Theo and Kee at the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: This child is our new beginning.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: That she is. BAM! Luke shoots. Theo recoils, hit in the gut, knocked back out the door. TAT-TAT-TAT. Glass shatters as guns fire from the outside ripping Luke to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo clears the doorway. He’s in momentary shock, against the wall, clutching his gut, looking at the blood oozing through his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: . KEE
dialogues.text: Fucker shot you.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I’m okay. Bullet went through. (gritting through pain) We gotta move. Theo breathing through the pain, holing up Kee, walking d the hall, the baby still crying. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The bullets intensifying from the outside, tearing throug the disintegrating facade, smashing into the hall wails - all that noise numbed by the baby’s cries. People huddled in the corridor, looking in disbelief. A woman falls to her knees.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (praying) Dios te salve Maria, llena eres de gracia, el senor es contigo, bendita eres entre las mujeres... They get closer to the stairwell. Bullets are still flyin but people seem fearless, poking their heads from doors, risking their safe spots to get a closer look. The baby’s crying gives an aura of security to Theo and K They are no longer ducking, walking straight down the hal A man breaks into tears. An old woman bleeding to death o the floor reaches her gnarled finger to touch the baby’s garment. She smiles as they pass -- she has heard the son of an angel. Theo and Kee arrive at the stairs. Kee starts to walk dow but Theo stops her.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: You’re shot.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I can do it. Kee allows Theo to pick her up. He grunts with the effort and begins carrying them down:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby’s Cry expands through the contained space. Theo carrying Kee down, using the wall for support. People huddled on the stairs, looking with amazement. People peering down at them from the upper floors. TAT-TAT-TAT. A gun battie, coming up the stairs toward th Patric and 2 Fishes are backing up the stairs, shooting d at pursuing soldiers below, who answer with a round of fi Patric hears crying, turning, pointing his gun at:

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Theo and Kee, no place to hide. Patric pointing the gun a Theo’s head, about to pull the trigger. But the baby is wailing in Kee’s arms. Patric looking at the baby in stun disbelief. Then he lowers his gun. He and the Fishes back away, staring at the baby as Theo and Kee head down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunfire from below forces people against the wall. Theo a Ree continue walking down. Heavy footsteps. A soldier surges up the stairs, pointing his gun at the newborn gir who wails away. Theo and Kee walk past him. The soldier breathless, the c conflicting with his adrenaline.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Hold positions and hold fire! Theo continues carrying Kee down. People on the stairs standing up, getting a look. More soldiers, holding their weapons in silence, stilled by the baby’s cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby cries echo through the lobby, now held by the military. Soldiers hold strategic positions, watching The and Kee pass, glimpsing the child in confusion, awe. At the shattered doorway, Theo staggers. Kee sees his swe his pain. His shirt is covered in blood.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Put me down. Theo hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: I wanna walk. Theo sets Kee down on her feet. Kee walks slowly, resolutely, leaning on Theo for support. They pass throug the shattered doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo, Kee and the baby step into the murky light of the f day. An impenetrable line of soldiers positioned in the plaza face them, their weapons pointed, ready. The heavy machinery of war silenced by the cries of a baby. Theo and Kee walk forward, toward the soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The weapons aimed at them begin to lower. An instinctive shuffle to the side, as if commanded by the cry, creating space for them to pass. Kee carrying her child, Theo limping at her side, bleedin as the ocean of soldiers part like the Red Sea, allowing to pass through. The somber faces of the soldiers, watchi touched by the baby’s crying. BAM! BAM! BAM! Rifle shots from the 4th floor window shat the silence. Two soldiers behind Theo are hit. Theo covers Kee as soldiers open fire at the apartment bl From the windows, guns fire back. A new battle flares. Theo and Kee walk, ignored by the soldiers that surge forward, taking new positions. KA-BOOM. The tank blasts a massive hole in the 4th floor.

dialogues.speaker: CORNER
dialogues.text: Leaving the battle behind, Kee and Theo walking down the street, Theo limping badly. Marichka surges from the corn holding Santo, greeting them with a bad-toothed smile. Th Sewer Rat by her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sewer Rat pulling off a sewer lid, Theo grunting as h helps get it off the rest of the way. Theo kneeling there gasping, his face drained. The baby still crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ceiling lamp illuminates a concrete sewer drain, a narr channel of foul water running through it. Boxes of contra stacked to one side: alcohol, batteries, medicine, cans o food, electrical wire. Marichka giving some bills to the Sewer Rat. Theo sitting in a BOAT, a simple wooden launch with two paddles, moored with a rope to the side. He’s in bad shap He helps Kee accommodate herself in back. She’s holding a candle. Marichka comes to them, prattling on, Santo on her should gesturing toward the end of the tunnel where ambient ligh filters in.

dialogues.speaker: MARICHKA
dialogues.text: Go, go boat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Theo extends his hand to help Marichka into the Launch.

dialogues.speaker: MARICHKA
dialogues.text: Marichka no go. Marichka counts off a few bills for herself, handing the of the wad to Theo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (waves it off) Marichka keep. Marichka smiles. She pushes the launch into motion. Theo starts to row. Kee holding the candle, she puts the baby on her breast. The baby quiets, feeding. Glimpses of graffiti on the walls like cave paintings. Marichka receding in darkness, holding Santo, waving at t

dialogues.speaker: AT THE END OF THE TUNNEL
dialogues.text: A breeze from outside extinguishes the candle. Theo rows toward the light. Passing through a metal grate that has been cut away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The launch emerges into the fog, distant sounds of the ri filtering through. A barbed-wire fence running the length shoreline separates them from Bexhill. They ride the drainage channel that feeds a short distanc into the sea. EXT. THE SEA’S EDGE ~+- CONTINUOUS The launch coming out of the channel, meeting the sea, Th rowing in pain. The fog obscuring the riot in the city. Dead calm, but the tide is on their side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What lays beyond obscured by milky fog. Theo rowing, slowing slightly, strength waning. The fog h enveloped the city behind them, the riots a distant echo. The world around them has disappeared. Ahead of them, the fog gives way, opening into sunlight. Revealing the rhythmic flashing of a BUOY. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: , KEE
dialogues.text: The buoy! Theo, the buoy! Theo rows once more, groaning with the effort.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: What time is it? The launch gains momentum, then slows. The sun now visibl touching the horizon, the day ending.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Late.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: They’1l wait. Kee is alert, looking around, the buoy rocking rhythmical splashing water. Theo stops rowing, tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I am sorry, Kee. I am so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: We gonna make it. Theo shakes his head, eyes wet. He knows.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna make it. Kee looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: And I’1l never know if you make it. Theo smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: But I want to believe that you will.

dialogues.speaker: . KEE
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Promise?

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ yeah.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Cheedo. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Theo’s coat opens, revealing a nasty gut wound. —

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You remember those spring days in London when the sun shines. It was one of those days. People taking their shirts off. Some had flowers in their hair. Music was playing. It was like a big celebration. And suddenly people were running in all directions. People falling, stepping on each other, panic. Julian got carried away, swallowed in the crowd. And it came so hard. The rubber bullet. Knocked me flat on my back... When I got up I saw the blood. And he wasn’t moving. I put my arm around him to protect him. You get it? I put my arm around him to protect him after he was dead. The boat drifting.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Dylan.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Huh? ~

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Gonna call her Dylan. Girl's name too, yeh? Theo in pain, genuinely smiles.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (to baby) Hi, Dylan. Theo musters all he’s got left, reaching the oars back, w cutting through water, grunting his last breath, propelli the launch a little farther. And that’s it. Theo’s body slumps as the launch loses momentum. And slow No direction. Drifting. Kee's eyes fill with tears.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: (a whisper) Theo... No response. “ (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The water slaps at the edges of the launch. The sun spewi a final burst of color as it disappears behind the horizo the day ending. Behind the buoy -- A BOAT. Cutting through the water towards them.

dialogues.speaker: KEE
dialogues.text: Theo! “The Tomorrow”! But Theo doesn’t move, The wooden vessel approaching, nets and gear -- A FISHING BOAT. The name painted on the stern. “THE TOMORROW”. FADE OUT.
